intro: Romulea ramiflora var. contorta, commonly known as the twisted ramiflorous romulea, is a perennial bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, twisted, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking, showy flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its unique morphology and vibrant floral display make it a notable species in botanical gardens and horticultural collections.
